newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Euro-MP calls for database on missing children.
newsitem.headline: Euro-MP calls for database on missing children.

text.p: The European Union police agency Europol should set up a special database to help track down missing children, according to Mary Banotti, the European Parliament's mediator on abducted children.

The database, which would contain information on all children missing under the age of 16, has been made urgent by the Belgian paedophila scandal which has shocked the world, the Irish Euro-MP told the Parliament's culture committee on Tuesday.
"Those who have children can pass easily through our borders, this is now a Europeanwide issue," Banotti was reported in a statement as saying.
"Not all children who disappear are criminally abducted but some are and we have no accurate figures about the extent of the problem," she said.
